p: Recombination events between BATV and Bunyamwera virus generated Ngari virus (NRIV), which has mainly been reported in Africa. The first isolation of NRIV was done from Ae. simpsoni in Senegal in 1979. It was also isolated from An. gambiae and An. pharoensis, and cytopathic effects were observed in Vero cells [ 36]. Pools of An. funestus collected in Kenya between 2007 and 2012 were positive for NRIV RNA by RT-PCR and sequencing. The full genome sequence of NRIV was obtained from mosquito and human samples [ 94].
